instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - No fan spin - Green / Orange light present
threads.message:
Hi Team,

I have a MBP early 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.  When the computer power button is pressed the chime is heard but nothing seen on the screen.

Customer mentioned that they bought a Chinese Charger as the original charger was not available in the store.

Inspected the board and found that some solder balls were found near the CAPS that belong to the <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> - namely - <CAPACITOR>C7766</CAPACITOR> / <CAPACITOR>C7767</CAPACITOR> / <CAPACITOR>C7768</CAPACITOR> / <CAPACITOR>C7769</CAPACITOR> / <CAPACITOR>C7770</CAPACITOR> / <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> / <CAPACITOR>C7772</CAPACITOR>.

These are the power rails that I checked so far and here are my readings.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.56v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 16.83v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> -  3.43v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>  - 5.03v
​<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>  - 0v
​<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>  - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> -  3.34v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> - 0.18V 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> -  0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> - 0V

Am I missing anything.  Further help would be appreciated.

Thanks and Regards,

Raj.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - No fan spin - Green / Orange light present
threads.message: So the machines chimes yet there is no voltages on any S3 and S0 rail. It must be haunted!
